etymology.description: Depicts a heavenly body or a celestial presence, often associated with dragons in ancient mythology.
etymology.interpretation: 辰(辰) (chén, "early form of dragon") originally depicted a celestial body that was believed to influence time and was associated with dragons due to mythological links between dragons and celestial phenomena.

examples.chinese: 古代传说中的辰是神秘而强大的生物(古代傳說中的辰是神秘而強大的生物)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài chuánshuō zhōng de chén shì shénmì ér qiángdà de shēngwù.
examples.english: In ancient legends, the chén is a mysterious and powerful creature.

examples.chinese: 东方初升的朝阳映照着辰的鳞光(東方初升的朝陽映照著辰的鱗光)，唤起了古老的神话(喚起了古老的神話)。
examples.pinyin: Dōngfāng chūshēng de cháoyáng yìngzhào zhe chén de línguāng, huànqǐ le gǔlǎo de shénhuà.
examples.english: The rising morning sun in the east illuminates the scales of the chén, evoking ancient myths.

examples.chinese: 传承了古老智慧的文献记载了辰的奇迹(傳承了古老智慧的文獻記載了辰的奇蹟)，使后人对它充满敬畏(使後人對它充滿敬畏)。
examples.pinyin: Chuánchéng le gǔlǎo zhìhuì de wénxiàn jìzǎi le chén de qíjī, shǐ hòurén duì tā chōngmǎn jìngwèi.
examples.english: Ancient texts carrying old wisdom recorded the miracles of the chén, filling later generations with awe.
